item.title: CONTRIBUTING
item.description: Thanks for your interest in contributing! This project is for learning and sharing JavaScript concepts, so all constructive contributions are welcome. Fork the repository. Create a new branch for your change: bashgit checkout -b feature/your-feature-name Make your edits or additions. Commit your changes with a clear message: bash1git commit -m "Add explanation for Array.map()" Push to your fork: bash1git push origin feature/your-feature-name Open a Pull Request to the main branch. Use ESLint and Prettier to keep code consistent. Follow modern JavaScript syntax (ES6+). Prefer clarity over clever tricks. Comment where necessary — remember this repo is for learning. If you're adding a code example: Keep it short, clear, and runnable. Add a short explanation in Markdown. Place it in the correct topic folder (e.g., /basics, /async, /dom, etc.) If you find bugs, unclear explanations, or mistakes: Open an Issue and describe what’s wrong clearly. Optionally suggest how it could be improved. By contributing, you agree that your work will be licensed under the same license as this project MIT.
item.dc:creator: neuxdotdev
